2nd Best Segment: Certification option exists, but only for farmers who meet criteria relating to economic and technical constraints. This is known as Communal Farmer Group certification. As with the Farm Group model all standard criteria are applicable to all members, but the expectation for records, plans and audit practices is different. For Communal Farmer Groups, plans and records that are representative of all members are created by the ICS at the group level rather than at the individual farmer level, and during audits more emphasis is placed on animal welfare outcomes as a measure of whether good practices are in place.
